intro: Inobulbon layardii, commonly known as the Layard's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial plant characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a unique floral structure typical of the spurge family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Inobulbon layardii is known for its ability to tolerate saline conditions, making it a hardy species in challenging landscapes.
